summary:
Expert in environmental impact assessments | Effective problem solver | Innovative 

I put my expertise into practice to inform evidence-based decision-making towards a sustainable future.

Key sustainability topics that I work on address questions like: 
How does global change affect social-ecological systems? 
How do we mitigate human impacts on the climate system?

I use a broad set of analysis approaches to answer these questions by integrating geo-spatial and qualitative data: 
- spatial analysis & remote sensing frameworks
- machine learning and cloud computing
- scenario analyses
- systematic literature reviews

Areas of interest:
- climate change mitigation & adaptation in the agriculture and forestry sectors
- sustainable intensification & diversification of food production systems
- climate change adaptation of nature conservation areas

profile_positions.description:
Working at JKI's Research Centre for Agricultural Remote-Sensing. 
Leading research on:
- Scaleable crop yield modelling by using multi-temporal, high-resolution remote sensing, meteorological, and soil data fuelling machine-learning ensembles
- Retrospective crop yield estimation and in-season yield forecasting
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description:
- Sustainable intensification & diversification of cocoa agroforestry systems
- Climate-smart land use
- Social-ecological resilience
- Farm development plans (FDPs)
- Farm economics
profile_positions.title: Analyst

company.name: CIFOR - Center for International Forestry Research

profile_positions.company: CIFOR - Center for International Forestry Research
profile_positions.description: Development of targeting and planning approaches to support climate-smart landscapes linking agriculture and forests in East Africa. My work focuses on sustainable intensification of smallholder livestock production at landscape level reducing the anthropogenic pressure on tropical forest systems. Target countries are Kenya and Tanzania. The project was funded by IFAD and CCAFS.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Developing and testing a decision-support framework to target climate-smart agriculture in Kenya.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Quantitative and spatially-explicit assessments of nutrient budgets and GHG emissions sources of agricultural and forest landscapes in East Africa.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: EU-funded project on the prospects of sustainable production and use of bioenergy (Innovations-Inkubator)
profile_positions.title: Scientific Consultant

profile_positions.description:
» Key topics of my work:

Spatial analyses of global change effects on ecosystems and current protection schemes to assess proper adaptation strategies
Spatial analyses of ecosystem services (linkages & trade-offs)
Spatially explicit ecological niche modeling of several animal & plant species, including tests for niche differentiations
Systematic & quantitative literature analyses of peer reviewed scientific articles
Writing & publishing of scientific work: project reports and peer-reviewed papers
Supervision of several Bachelor & Master's theses

» Key experiences:

Compilation & spatial processing of heterogeneous (social-)ecological and environmental data, including remote sensing; land-use / land cover; past, current and future climate (GCM projection) data; presence-only & geographic range datasets; biodiversity & ecosystem service datasets; survey based data
Geospatial modeling with ArcGIS
Geospatial scripting with Python (ArcPy)
Climate envelope modeling with MAXENT
Ecological modeling in R including univariate approaches such as LMs, GLMs & multivariate approaches such as ordinations (PCA, RDA) and cluster techniques
Visualizing scientific results: geographic maps, plots and graphics

» Main ecosystem expertise: 

Temperate rainforests in North America
Mountain ecosystems in Central & Eastern Europe

» Field work experiences:

In the Southern / Eastern Carpathian mountains (Romania) and the Hainich National Park (Germany) for population genetic / phylogenetic analyses and habitat / climate envelope modeling
